thread.title: Chicagoans hit the streets for Monday's Not My President's Day rally
thread.title_full: Chicagoans hit the streets for Monday's Not My President's Day rally

author: Staff Writer
title: Chicagoans hit the streets for Monday's Not My President's Day rally
text:
By Zach Long Posted: Tuesday February 21 2017, 4:16pm Photograph: Neal O'Bryan 
On Monday, protesters all across the nation took to the streets to participate in a series of Not My President's Day rallies, coinciding with the national President's Day holiday. The demonstration against Donald Trump was started by a group of L.A. activists, but quickly became a network of small rallies throughout the U.S. 
In Chicago, the protest took place in front of Trump Tower, with an estimated 800 people in attendance according to the Chicago Tribune . Attendees brandished clever signs and shouted slogans, expressing their discontent with the actions of the current administration. It might not have been as well-attended as the Women's March , but the message of frustration and anger was just as clear. Take a look at some photos from the rally below.
